text: Hot FM is a Malaysian CHR station owned by Synchrosound Studio Sdn Bhd, a subsidiary of Media Prima. Broadcasts transmitted from Sri Pentas in Bandar Utama. The station operates 24 hours a day; broadcasting a mixed selections of songs in Malay, Indonesian and English; though Malay is the major language used. == History == Hot FM previously operated as WaFM, which was owned by producer and actor Tiara Jacquelina. Media Prima acquired the station not long after and began test transmissions from 15 January 2006 to 6 February 2006, in which the station officially commenced operations led by Sathiaseelan a/l Paul Thurai, who was a former presenter with Era FM. In 2009, Hot FM went down in history as for the first time it was charted at the top among other radio stations in Malaysia with 3.8 million weekly listeners, ahead of its traditional rival Era FM which only reached 3.76 million listeners in a week. == Radio announcers == === Main announcers (effective 1 July 2019) === * Fizie * Shuib Sepahtu * Shuk Sahar * Deen * Haziq Hussni * Zetty Nabila === Weekend announcers === * Sara Zulkifli ( Sarancak ) * Ijal Azhar * Adam Tun Tuah * Fieyna Azman * Shahir Subari === Former announcers === * Fiqrie Dahari * Nik Nor Azura Nik Mahmud * Kartini Kamalul Arifin * Anne * Faizal Ismail * Syed Mohd Asri (Usop Wilcha) * Chad * Suraya * Maskiran Jakiran (Kieran) * Sharifah Aleya * Liza Khairudin * Farah Fauzana * AG Azmeer (moved to Kool FM) * Mohd Khairul Ikhwan Rosli * Rea (moved to Kool FM) * Tun Nadia Aminuddin * Rafly Rahamat * Issey Titan * Ajak Shiro * Ammar Titan * El Saifuddin == Frequency == {| class="wikitable" !
